Legal_Issue: Whether the Pension Appeal Board erred in granting leave to appeal without providing adequate reasons
Governing_Law: Canada Pension Plan and related regulations
Decision_Outcome: Leave to appeal granted ex parte without reasons
Legal_Rule: A designated member must provide written reasons when exercising discretion, especially if the application for leave is deficient
Standard_of_Review: Reasonableness or correctness (implied by judicial review context)
Procedural_Issue: Failure to provide reasons for granting leave to appeal
Grounds_for_Claim: Lack of new evidence or identified legal errors in the appeal, failure to meet Rule 4 requirements
Decision_Maker: Designated member of the Pension Appeal Board
Review_Standard: Error in law due to lack of procedural fairness
Procedural_Fairness_Assessment: Failure to provide reasons violated procedural fairness standards
Legal_Framework: Canada Pension Plan, Rule 4 of the relevant procedural rules
Applicant_Challenge: Attorney General of Canada challenged the Board's decision
Court_Result: Decision set aside; matter remitted for reconsideration
Legal_Rule_Source: Canada Pension Plan and related regulations
Remedy_Requested: Judicial review of the Board's decision
Outcome: Court allowed judicial review, set aside the decision, and referred back for reconsideration
Remedy_Sought: Setting aside the Boardâ€™s decision and requiring reconsideration with reasons
Legal_Provision: Rule 4 of the Pension Appeal Board procedures
Claimant_Status: Attorney General of Canada as applicant for judicial review
Grounds_for_Inadmissibility_or_Allegatio: Application lacked new evidence and failed to identify legal error
Applicable_Process: Pension appeal process under the Canada Pension Plan
Outcome_of_Review: In favor of the Attorney General; decision overturned
Pending_Relief_or_Application: Reconsideration of leave to appeal by the Pension Appeal Board
Jurisdiction: Federal jurisdiction under the Canada Pension Plan
Governing_Rule: Requirement to provide written reasons when exercising discretionary authority
